meanings.definition: To wash or leach out soluble constituents of (soil, rock, etc.) by the action of percolating water.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the water eluviated the nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent2: The river eluviated the minerals from the rocks over time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel eluviated all the seeds from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her tears eluviated the pain from her heart, leaving her feeling lighter.
meanings.sent5: The constant dripping of the faucet eluviated the patience of the homeowner.

meanings.definition: To remove or dissolve out by the action of a solvent.
meanings.sent1: The chemist eluviated the impurities from the solution.
meanings.sent2: The soap eluviated the dirt from the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The detective eluviated the truth from the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: Time eluviated the memories of the old house from her mind.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun eluviated the frost from the window pane.
